# Part 1

# a 
# Generate 5 random digits from 0 to 9 and store it in vector 洧녤_1.
(v_1 <- trunc(runif(5, 0, 9)))

# A vector 洧녤_3 repeating the number 7, ten times.
(v_3 <- rep(7, 10))

# b

(v <- c(v_1, v_2, v_3))

# c
# Remove all numbers greater than 10 from vector 洧녤
# save the result in vector 洧녥
(w <- v[v<=10]) # for getting the sub list

# d
v
w



# Part 2

# a
n = 30
# Generate random vector x_1 from normal distribution with 
# mean = 10 and var = 4
(x_1 <- rnorm(n, mean = 10, sd = 2))
# b
# Generate random vector x_2 = 3 + y where y has normal distribution with

(x_2 = 3 + rnorm(n, mean = 0, sd = 5))

# c

plot(x_1, x_2, 
    col = "blue", 
    main = "x_1 vs x_2", 
    sub = "Hussain", 
    xlab = "x_1", 
    ylab = "y_1",
    ) 
# d
